channel.title: Different coloured Loading text?

item.title: Different coloured Loading text?
item.dc:creator: @PsychoScapeRSPS PsychoScapeRSPS
item.description:
@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:5, topic:424041”]If the text is blue than the problem is obviously not where the white (0xffffff) lies. It will be either:

Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 152, 304, 34, 0xf5fffa, j, true);

Or

Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method336(30, j + 2, c / 2 - 150, 0x778899, i * 3, 0); [/quote]

Sorry, but the first on didn’t do anything and the second one turned my loading bar (inside of my loading box) white.

I only what the text ABOVE my loading box to be white…>.< Why can’t I do this?

Read full topic

item.title: Different coloured Loading text?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude462 sk8rdude462
item.description:
@sk8rdude462 wrote:

Wintercanon:

It’s called hexadecimal [hexa(6)decimal(10)] because it’s a base-16 number system.

I know this. Learned about it last year in my computer class. I was dumb-ing it down lol

Read full topic

item.title: Different coloured Loading text?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude462 sk8rdude462
item.description:
@sk8rdude462 wrote:

How to read Hex color:

0x - client sided that just shows it’s reading Hex.
FF (first set) - These are the red colors. You can use 0-9 and A-F
FF (Second set) - These are the green colors. ^
FF (Third set) - These are the blue colors. ^
FF is the highest possible value in each hex set.
00 is the lowest possible value in each hex set.

Read full topic

item.title: Different coloured Loading text?
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

If the text is blue than the problem is obviously not where the white (0xffffff) lies. It will be either:

Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 152, 304, 34, 0xf5fffa, j, true);

Or

Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method336(30, j + 2, c / 2 - 150, 0x778899, i * 3, 0);

item.description:
@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:2, topic:424041”]First off… wrong section. This would be the server help section work your way to the client help next time. Eh too bad rs2 clients are not refactored.

0xffffff = white
http://html-color-codes.com/
Look at method381

Edit : Also read up on http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/index.html[/quote]

Sorry and thanks!

This is the current code for my method381

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method381(0xffffff, s, 23693, (c1 / 2 + 5) - byte1, c / 2);

And yet the text is still blue!
O.O WTF?

item.title: Different coloured Loading text?
item.dc:creator: @PsychoScapeRSPS PsychoScapeRSPS
item.description:
@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

This is the bit of code that displays “PsychoScape is loading - don’t panic.” above my loading bar in my RSPS client:

}
    aClass15_1109.method237(0);
    char c = '\u0168';
    char c1 = '\310';
    byte byte1 = 20;
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method381(128, "PsychoScape is loading - don't panic.", 23693, c1 / 2 - 26 - byte1, c / 2);
    int j = c1 / 2 - 18 - byte1;
    // Colours
    Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 152, 304, 34, 0xf5fffa, j, true);
    Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 151, 302, 32, 0, j + 1, true);
    Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method336(30, j + 2, c / 2 - 150, 0x778899, i * 3, 0);
    Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method336(30, j + 2, (c / 2 - 150) + i * 3, 0, 300 - i * 3, 0);
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method381(0xffffff, s, 23693, (c1 / 2 + 5) - byte1, c / 2);
    aClass15_1109.method238(171, 23680, super.aGraphics12, 202);
    if(byte0 != 4) {
        for(int k = 1; k > 0; k++);
    }

HOW do I change the colour of the text ABOVE my loading bar?
Which variable do I change?
I want the text to be white.

Thanks,
Psycho

Read full topic
